question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Race Condition] If minimum is increased after maximum is set, can the bounds become inverted (min > max)? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_minimum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Narrow Range Attack] Can min and max be set to nearly identical values (e.g., min=X, max=X+1) to make price updates fail constantly? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Early Return Bypass] Lines 387-389 return early if primary already equals provider - can this prevent necessary validation checks from running when re-setting to the same provider? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Provider Config Check] Can an attacker set a primary provider that exists in oracle_provider_configs but is disabled, since the enable check occurs after assignment? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Validation Inconsistency] Lines 409-411 check provider_configs existence only if provider is not empty - can an empty secondary provider be set without validation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Enable Check Missing] Unlike set_primary_oracle_provider(), set_secondary_oracle_provider() doesn't verify the provider is enabled - can a disabled provider be set as secondary? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Same Provider Attack] Can primary and secondary be set to the same provider, defeating the redundancy mechanism? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [State Transition] If primary provider is changed while price updates are in progress, can this cause inconsistent price data? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_oracle_provider_config()] [Duplicate Prevention] Line 421 checks if provider already exists in configs - but can an attacker create configs with same pair_id but different providers? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_oracle_provider_config()] [Enable Parameter] The enable parameter allows creating disabled configs - can this be exploited to create unusable provider configs that block legitimate ones? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_provider_config_pair_id()] [Pair ID Validation] No validation exists for pair_id format or content - can arbitrary/malicious pair_ids be set? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_provider_config_enable()] [Primary Provider Check] Line 447 prevents disabling a provider if it's being used as primary - but what if it's being used as secondary? Can secondary provider be disabled mid-operation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_provider_config_enable()] [Race Condition] Can a provider be disabled between when it's checked and when it's used for price fetching? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_provider_config_enable()] [Timing Attack] Can an attacker repeatedly enable/disable providers to cause price update failures? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Timer Bypass] Lines 466-468 return early if timer > 0 - can this prevent timer updates even when it should be reset? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Timestamp Manipulation] No validation of timestamp parameter - can an attacker pass timestamp=1 to set an extremely old timer start? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: reset_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Zero Check] Lines 476-478 return early if timer is 0 - but is this correct logic? Should resetting an already-reset timer be a no-op or an error? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Duration Bypass] Can an attacker call this with future timestamps to bypass max_duration_within_thresholds checks? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: reset_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Race Condition] If reset is called while start_or_continue is executing, can timer state become inconsistent? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer()] [Overflow] Can timestamp values close to u64::MAX cause overflow when duration calculations are performed elsewhere? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: keep_history_update()] [Price Validation] No validation of price parameter - can price=0 or price=u256::MAX be set as historical price? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: keep_history_update()] [Timestamp Validation] No validation that updated_time is greater than previous history.updated_time - can timestamps go backwards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: keep_history_update()] [Atomicity] Are price and updated_time updated atomically, or can they be in inconsistent states if accessed during update? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: keep_history_update()] [Overwrite Attack] Can an attacker repeatedly call this to prevent legitimate price history from being preserved? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_enable_to_price_feed()] [State Transition] Can a price feed be disabled during active price updates, causing in-flight operations to fail? (High)
